snippet: For nearly two decades, the company has struggled to tame ammonium nitrate, an inexpensive but unstable compound used to inflate its airbags.
abstract: Japanese manufacturer Takata has struggled for nearly two decades to tame ammonium nitrate, inexpensive but unstable compound thought to play central role in airbag ruptures that have been linked to deaths, injuries and recent recalls; company has stated that compound is safe, but patent application from December, 2013, points to lingering concerns about its vulnerability to moisture and temperature changes.
lead_paragraph: For nearly two decades, the company has struggled to tame ammonium nitrate, an inexpensive but unstable compound used to inflate its airbags.

headline.main: Airbag Compound Has Vexed Takata for Years
headline.print_headline: Airbag Compound Has Vexed Takata for Years
